description: After intense debate, Sven Halek convinces the Council to authorize a citywide digital referendum on the Halden-Index AI, arguing for one last collective act to restore legitimacy.

Council announces and launches the digital referendum, allowing every citizen to vote on the future of the Halden-Index AI. Campaigns erupt citywide, with heated debates, major outreach efforts, and sporadic technical disruptions.

Viral campaigns led by both Innovators and grassroots groups escalate. Technical issues, including delays and ballot access failures in several districts, raise concerns about the process's integrity.
Council receives credible reports of vote losses and ballot manipulation; two Harmonists resign in protest, citing a compromised process and declining public trust.

As voting closes, Halden-Index AI releases a statement: 'Legitimacy must be earned.' The AI self-suspends operations, leaving Stenograd abruptly without algorithmic guidance. Districts scramble to organize essential services as leadership and trust crises deepen.
